1. (S) Tactical Situation:
Before the onset of hostilities between NATO and Warsaw Pact forces, REDFOR pre-positioned several high-value assets, including a Kiev-class carrier battle group (CVBG), in a calculated effort to seize the initiative from BLUFOR. In accordance with the Forward Maritime Strategy, it is imperative that we regain the operational advantage by neutralizing these key Soviet assets.
Soviet forces have successfully established positions along the Bosphorus Straits and the Aegean Sea. The Kievâ€™s presence in the region significantly strengthens the Soviet threat, making it a critical target for NATO forces.
NATO Maritime Command is executing a coordinated strike to neutralize all Soviet assets in the Mediterranean. The primary objective is the destruction of the Kiev CVBG before it can transit the Bosphorus Straits. Eliminating the Kiev is critical to securing control of the Mediterranean, and enabling a Marine-led counteroffensive to land in the Thrace.
2. (S) Primary Objective: Neutralize the Kiev CVHG before it escapes through the Bosphorus Straits.
3. (S) Threat Report:
The Kiev is currently being escorted by a minimum of three (3) large surface combatants. SATINT has confirmed the presence of multiple mobile SAM and anti-ship missile (AShM) batteries.
The threat posed by land-based Soviet Naval Aviation (SNA) units is assessed to be negligible at this time. However, the Kiev is carrying an undetermined number of Yak-38 fighter-bombers, which could pose a limited air threat to NATO forces operating in the area.
VMF submarines are not expected to be a factor in this operation. No significant submarine activity has been detected in the vicinity, and their involvement is currently deemed low-risk.
Moderate civilian traffic has been reported.
(S) No EMCON restrictions.
